Final Diploma Challenge

Basketball Fixture App

The Challenge

In the final challenge of my Diploma I was asked to develop a functional prototype in a six hour coding session. The protoype was required to fufill particular requirements. In the scenario we were given a local basketball league wanted a web application that team managers could use to create, edit and track fixtured matches, venues, and booking costs. The app required OAuth so that the managers could log in using their google accounts and that the data would only be able to be viewed or manipulated by authorized users. Another requirement was that the fixtures could be seperated into upcoming and past fixtures and that only past fixtures could have costs added. Lastly, it was required that the managers would have their total costs tallied and displayed next to their name.

The Solution

In order to achieve this, I began by creating a database project with a 'Managers' and 'Fixtures' table. I then created a ASP.Net Web application using Entity Framework and MVC to streamline the frontend development process. To achieve discrimination between upcoming and past fixtures I added two methods into my Fixtures Controller which would check if the current date was less or more than the date of each fixture, I then added views which would correspond with these parameters. To create functionality for users to add costs to past fixtures I simply removed the auto generated Update functionality from each page except my Past Fixtures page and to show the TotalSpent I added a method to my Managers View that would add the Fixtures Spent columns where the Managers Ids were the same. Finally, to implement the Authorization functionality I setup simple google Oauth which generated a new ASPNet database. I added the methods to all my controllers that would only allow Users to see the pages if their EmailConfirmed attribute was set to true. When new users were added this would automatically be set to 'false' and could then be changed by Authorized users in the ASPNetUsers view. To see these views click on the slideshow to the right.
